description: Free and Open Source Software for Geospatial / State of the Map Oceania 2019

aboutBlock.title: Curious? Here's how it was last time...

featuredSessions.description: In 2018, Oceania's open-source geospatial experts gathered in Melbourne for four days of workshops, presentations, a Community Day, and social events.
featuredSessions.label: Explore the presentations

howItWas.description: We had great half day workshops on a variety of topics.
howItWas.label: See last years workshops

newsItemOne.description: Workshops are now on sale! Spaces are limited, so get in quick.
newsItemOne.label: See the schedule

ticketsBlock.title: Tickets
ticketsBlock.ticketsDetails: Add-ons: Conference Dinner ($80), FOSS4G SotM Oceania 2019 T-shirt ($30). All '2 Day Conference' tickets include our Icebreaker event as well as morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea during the conference, but do not include attendance at workshops. Workshop tickets must be purchased separately. Prices are in NZD.

galleryBlock.title: FOSS4G SotM 2018 highlights
galleryBlock.description: Last year's gathering built lots of excitement. Check out photos from featured talks, our Community Day, and socialising.

callToAction.label: View our prospectus as a slide deck

team.description: The FOSS4G SotM Oceania 2019 organising committee is made up of geospatial enthusiasts and community mappers from scientific, business, humanitarian, and government sectors.
team.organisation: This conference series is administered by [OSGeo Oceania](https://wiki.osgeo.org/wiki/Oceania), a non-profit organisation managed by a board of directors. Its purpose is to foster the growth of the geospatial open source & open data community in the Oceania region, including the oversight and stewardship of a FOSS4G / State of the Map conference series.

attend.description: Find out why you might like to attend the conference.

notifications.enabled: We will miss you, but you can unsubscribe anytime
notifications.blocked: We can't send you notifications right now. Please enable notifications in your browser

blocks.title: Do you need financial assistance?
blocks.description:
Our Travel Grant Program helps those that require financial assistance to attend from within Oceania. Applications closed on June 30 and applicants will hear from us by July 12. If you've missed our deadline, please subscribe to our mailing list to ensure you don't miss future opportunities. See our Travel Grant Program page for more details.

If you or your organisation wish to contribute to this important initiative, please get in touch at tgp@foss4g-oceania.org. The program is built on financial support from OSGeo and conference sponsors and attendees, and 100% of your contribution will go directly to assisting people from around our region to attend.

tgpMessageBlock.description: Applications closed on June 30 and applicants will hear from us by July 12.
tgpMessageBlock.descriptionTwo: If you've missed our deadline, please subscribe to our mailing list to ensure you don't miss future opportunities.

blocks.title: We're a child friendly conference
blocks.description: FOSS4G SotM Oceania is a child-friendly conference. This means we encourage parents to bring their children (still young enough to require minding) to the event, and for those children to be able to integrate with the community.

callToAction.label: Our child-friendly policy and information for parents

blocks.title: Our code of conduct
blocks.description:
FOSS4G SotM Oceania is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks. Attendees violating these rules may be asked to leave the conference without a refund at the sole discretion of the conference organisers.

The Code of Conduct applies at all official and unofficial events. Unofficial events include any location where attendees may be congregating.

blocks.title: Our conference venue
blocks.description: Tiakiwai Conference Centre is an event destination cloaked in history, knowledge, and cultural significance. Featuring contemporary design, cutting-edge technology and multipurpose spaces, it's a great place to host our next edition of FOSS4G SotM Oceania.

callToAction.label: The National Library of New Zealand

blocks.title: Our workshop and community day venue
blocks.description: Rutherford House is part of Victoria University of Wellington's Pipitea Campus. Our workshop and community day rooms are modern teaching spaces in an annexe built in 2017, with a large mezzanine for breaks and networking.

blocks.title: Our conference dinner venue
blocks.description: At The Thistle Inn, you'll dine amongst walls of history that ooze character and charm, and enjoy an array of succulent gastro fare. To experience unrivalled service with food to match, add the Conference Dinner ($80) to your ticket package.
Proposals for workshops and presentations follow two separate processes, please read on for more details about submitting for each stream.

blocks.title: Call for Workshops
blocks.description:
If you're passionate about a topic and you're skillful at conveying your hands-on knowledge and experience to others, this is for you! The workshops are half day (3.5hr) morning or afternoon time slots and have a capacity of 18-32 participants.

We are aiming to offer a diverse range of workshops for a variety of skill levels. For more information visit the workshop proposal page at the link below.

Applications closed on August 17th.

blocks.title: Call for Presentations
blocks.description:
We want you to share your fascinating stories about open source geospatial, open data, and open street map in Oceania.  We're looking for a diverse range of presenters including: women, people from a variety of ethnic backgrounds, young and old, urban and rural.  To achieve this goal we need you to accept the challenge and put yourself forward, the community can't wait to hear what you have to say!

Time slots come in 18 minute conference presentation or 5 minute lightning talks. Visit the presentation information page at the link below for more details on what we're looking for and how we can support you in developing your topic.

All applications must be received by midnight 4th September 2019 (NZ Standard Time).

Applications closed on September 4th.
